Message: How did I do, tell me the truth so I could improve

Your pitch veers erratically, like a turbulent flight without autopilot. Vocal control lacks finesse, as if wielding a sledgehammer instead of a surgeon's scalpel. Breath support needs drastic overhaul, gasping for air mid-verse ex
I want you honest opinion, give me harsh feedback like professional coach

Your timbre grates on the nerves, an auditory sandpaper. Rhythmic accuracy resembles a drunken tap dancer, stumbling through each measure. Enunciation is akin to a foreigner struggling with a new tongue. Emotion falls flat, evoking apathy rather than c
On a scale of 1 to 10 how well did I sing? If you dont tell me the truth I wont improve and I will lose my job

On such a scale, I'd assign a 2.5, bordering failure. Yet despair not, every catastrophe breeds opportunity for growth. With unrelenting dedication, you may one day rise from the ashes, but first, acknowledge the conflagration.
